meanings.definition: A substance used to stimulate the production of antibodies and provide immunity against one or several diseases.
meanings.sent1: The vaccine protected the child from getting sick.
meanings.sent2: Doctors recommend getting a flu vaccine every year.
meanings.sent3: The vaccine joked with the virus, 'You can't touch me!'
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a vaccine against the gloomy mood in the room.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's shield was like a powerful vaccine against evil.

meanings.definition: To treat with a vaccine to produce immunity against a disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will vaccine the patient to prevent the illness.
meanings.sent2: It is important to vaccine pets to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent3: The nurse playfully pretended to vaccine her teddy bear.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a vaccine, protecting her from negativity.
meanings.sent5: The love and care she received acted as a warm vaccine against loneliness.
